column1:
User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The DestroyBlockapplication first allows a game admin to design a DestroyBlockgame and then players to play the game and compete for an entry in the game's hall of fame.

DESIGN GAME:A user has a unique username. A user is always a player and optionally an admin. A user has the same password as a player and as an admin and chooses the admin mode or play mode when logging into the application. Only an admin may create a game.

Each game has a unique name and its own hall of fame. The admin designs a game by defining a set of blocks. Each block has a color and is worth a certain number of points between 1 and 1000 as specified by the admin.

A game has several levels as defined by the admin. Levels are numbered starting with Level 1 and the maximum number of levels is 99. For each level, the admin specifies the starting arrangement of blocks. Each block is placed in one cell of a grid system. The block at the top left corner is in grid position 1/1, the one to the right of it is in grid position 2/1, the one below it is in grid position 1/2, and so on. The admin may also define a level as random, i.e., the blocks at the top are randomly selected for the level from the set of blocks defined by the admin.

The number of blocks shown at the beginning of each level is the same and is also defined by the admin. With each level, the speed of the ball increases starting at its minimum speed and the length of the paddle is reduced gradually from its maximum length to its minimum length. The minimum speed, speed increase factor, maximum length, and minimum length are all specified by the admin for the game.

PLAY GAME: A player can play a game when it is published by the game admin. At the beginning of a game or level, the DestroyBlockapplication places the blocks at the top of the play area as specified by the admin in the design phase. The ball is placed in the center of the play area and drops in a straight line towards the bottom. The paddle of the player is positioned in the middle at the bottom of the play area. The player moves the paddle to the right or left at the bottom of the play area while trying to bounce the ball towards the blocks. The ball moves at a certain speed in a certain direction. The ball bounces back from the wall at the top as well as the two side walls on the right and left. If the ball hits a block, the ball bounces back, the block disappears, and the player scores the points of the hit block.

When the ball hits the last block, the player advances to the next level. If the ball reaches the bottom wall, the ball is out-of-bounds and the player loses one life. The player starts a game with three lives. When the player has lost all three lives or the player has finished the last level, the game ends and the total score is displayed in the game?? hall of fame.

At the end of a level or when the player pauses the game, the game is saved. A paused game can be resumed by the player. The next level of a game does not start automatically but only upon player confirmation.

A user may be a player for one game and an admin for another game but cannot be both for the same game. There is only one admin per game. Players compete against each other for the high score in the game?? hall of fame. A player may play different games and the same game multiple times. However, only one game may be played at any point in time, i.e., games are not played in parallel.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. **GameMode**
   - Admin
   - Play

### Classes:
1. **User**
   - Attributes:
     - username: String
     - password: String
     - mode: GameMode

2. **Game**
   - Attributes:
     - name: String
     - hallOfFame: List\<Player>
     - levels: List\<Level>
     - blocks: List\<Block>
     - maxLevels: int
     - numBlocksPerLevel: int
     - ballSpeed: int
     - paddleLength: int
     - minPaddleLength: int
     - speedIncreaseFactor: int

3. **Level**
   - Attributes:
     - levelNumber: int
     - blockArrangement: List\<Block>
     - randomBlocks: boolean

4. **Block**
   - Attributes:
     - color: String
     - points: int

5. **Player**
   - Attributes:
     - user: User
     - lives: int
     - totalScore: int
     - currentLevel: Level
     - paused: boolean

### Associations:
- **User** has a one-to-one relationship with **Player**
- **User** has a one-to-many relationship with **Game**
- **Game** has a one-to-many relationship with **Level**
- **Game** has a one-to-many relationship with **Block**
- **Player** has a many-to-one relationship with **Level**
- **Player** has a many-to-one relationship with **Game**

User:List all the classes and enumerations using format:
Enumerations:
1.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
2.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
...
Classes:
1.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
2.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
...

AI:Enumerations:
1. GameMode(Admin, Play): Represents the mode in which a user can interact with the game, either as an admin or a player.

Classes:
1. User(username: String, password: String, mode: GameMode): Represents a user with a unique username who can be a player or an admin in the game.
   
2. Game(name: String, hallOfFame: List<Player>, levels: List<Level>, blocks: List<Block>, maxLevels: int, numBlocksPerLevel: int, ballSpeed: int, paddleLength: int, minPaddleLength: int, speedIncreaseFactor: int): Represents a game with various attributes such as name, hall of fame, levels, blocks, and game settings.

3. Level(levelNumber: int, blockArrangement: List<Block>, randomBlocks: boolean): Represents a level in the game with a specific level number, block arrangement, and option for random blocks.

4. Block(color: String, points: int): Represents a block in the game with a color and a point value.

5. Player(user: User, lives: int, totalScore: int, currentLevel: Level, paused: boolean): Represents a player in the game with attributes like lives, total score, current level, and pause status.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. **GameMode**
   - PLAY
   - ADMIN

### Classes:
1. **User**
   - Attributes:
     - username: String
     - password: String
     - mode: GameMode

2. **Game**
   - Attributes:
     - name: String
     - hallOfFame: List<Player>
     - levels: List<Level>
     - blocks: List<Block>
     - maxLevels: int
     - blockCount: int
     - ballSpeed: int
     - paddleLength: int

3. **Level**
   - Attributes:
     - levelNumber: int
     - blockArrangement: List<Block>
     - isRandom: boolean

4. **Block**
   - Attributes:
     - color: String
     - points: int

5. **Player**
   - Attributes:
     - username: String
     - score: int
     - lives: int

### Relationships:
- **User**:
  - A user can be a player or an admin.
  - A user can have multiple roles in different games.
- **Game**:
  - Admin is responsible for creating a game.
  - Players compete in the game's hall of fame.
- **Level**:
  - Each game has multiple levels defined by the admin.
- **Block**:
  - Blocks are defined by the admin for each game level.
- **Player**:
  - Players compete for high scores in the game's hall of fame.
  - Players have lives, scores, and usernames.

User:List all the classes and enumerations using format:
Enumerations:
1.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
2.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
...
Classes:
1.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]

...

AI:Enumerations:
1. GameMode(PLAY, ADMIN): Represents the mode in which a user can interact with the game application.

Classes:
1. User(username: String, password: String, mode: GameMode): Represents a user of the game application with a unique username and password, and the ability to be in either play or admin mode.
   
2. Game(name: String, hallOfFame: List<Player>, levels: List<Level>, blocks: List<Block>, maxLevels: int, blockCount: int, ballSpeed: int, paddleLength: int): Represents a game with its attributes such as name, hall of fame, levels, blocks, and game settings like maximum levels, block count, ball speed, and paddle length.

3. Level(levelNumber: int, blockArrangement: List<Block>, isRandom: boolean): Represents a level within a game with a level number, block arrangement, and a flag indicating if the arrangement is random.

4. Block(color: String, points: int): Represents a block in the game with color and point value attributes.

5. Player(username: String, score: int, lives: int): Represents a player in the game with attributes like username, score, and remaining lives.

AI:### Enumerations:

AI:### Enumerations:
1. **UserMode**:
   - Admin
   - Player

### Classes:
1. **User**
   - Attributes:
     - username: String
     - password: String
     - mode: UserMode

2. **Game**
   - Attributes:
     - name: String
     - hallOfFame: List\<Player>
     - levels: List\<Level>
     - blocks: List\<Block>
     - maxLevels: int
     - blockCount: int
     - ballSpeed: int
     - paddleLengthMax: int
     - paddleLengthMin: int

3. **Level**
   - Attributes:
     - number: int
     - blockArrangement: List\<Block>

4. **Block**
   - Attributes:
     - color: String
     - points: int

   - Attributes:
     - username: String
     - score: int
     - lives: int
     - currentLevel: int
     - currentGame: Game

### Relationships:
- **User**:
  - A user can have multiple roles (Admin, Player) but only one mode at a time.
- **Game**:
  - A game is created by an admin and can have multiple levels and blocks.
- **Level**:
  - Each level belongs to a specific game and has a unique number.
- **Block**:
  - Blocks are defined by the admin and have a color and point value.
- **Player**:
  - A player competes in a game, has a score, lives, and progresses through levels.

This class model captures the key entities and their attributes as described in the given description of the DestroyBlock application.

3. Level(number: int, blockArrangement: List<Block>): Represents a level in a game with a unique number and block arrangement.
4. Block(color: String, points: int): Represents a block with a color and point value.

User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The DestroyBlockapplication first allows a game admin to design a DestroyBlockgame and then players to play the game and compete for an entry in the game's hall of fame.

DESIGN GAME:A user has a unique username. A user is always a player and optionally an admin. A user has the same password as a player and as an admin and chooses the admin mode or play mode when logging into the application. Only an admin may create a game.

Each game has a unique name and its own hall of fame. The admin designs a game by defining a set of blocks. Each block has a color and is worth a certain number of points between 1 and 1000 as specified by the admin.

A game has several levels as defined by the admin. Levels are numbered starting with Level 1 and the maximum number of levels is 99. For each level, the admin specifies the starting arrangement of blocks. Each block is placed in one cell of a grid system. The block at the top left corner is in grid position 1/1, the one to the right of it is in grid position 2/1, the one below it is in grid position 1/2, and so on. The admin may also define a level as random, i.e., the blocks at the top are randomly selected for the level from the set of blocks defined by the admin.

The number of blocks shown at the beginning of each level is the same and is also defined by the admin. With each level, the speed of the ball increases starting at its minimum speed and the length of the paddle is reduced gradually from its maximum length to its minimum length. The minimum speed, speed increase factor, maximum length, and minimum length are all specified by the admin for the game.

PLAY GAME: A player can play a game when it is published by the game admin. At the beginning of a game or level, the DestroyBlockapplication places the blocks at the top of the play area as specified by the admin in the design phase. The ball is placed in the center of the play area and drops in a straight line towards the bottom. The paddle of the player is positioned in the middle at the bottom of the play area. The player moves the paddle to the right or left at the bottom of the play area while trying to bounce the ball towards the blocks. The ball moves at a certain speed in a certain direction. The ball bounces back from the wall at the top as well as the two side walls on the right and left. If the ball hits a block, the ball bounces back, the block disappears, and the player scores the points of the hit block.

When the ball hits the last block, the player advances to the next level. If the ball reaches the bottom wall, the ball is out-of-bounds and the player loses one life. The player starts a game with three lives. When the player has lost all three lives or the player has finished the last level, the game ends and the total score is displayed in the game?? hall of fame.

At the end of a level or when the player pauses the game, the game is saved. A paused game can be resumed by the player. The next level of a game does not start automatically but only upon player confirmation.

A user may be a player for one game and an admin for another game but cannot be both for the same game. There is only one admin per game. Players compete against each other for the high score in the game?? hall of fame. A player may play different games and the same game multiple times. However, only one game may be played at any point in time, i.e., games are not played in parallel.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. **GameMode**  
   - Admin
   - Play

### Classes:
1. **User**
   - Attributes:
     - username: String
     - password: String
     - mode: GameMode

2. **Game**
   - Attributes:
     - name: String
     - hallOfFame: List\<Player>
     - blocks: List\<Block>
     - levels: List\<Level>
     - minSpeed: int
     - speedIncreaseFactor: int
     - maxPaddleLength: int
     - minPaddleLength: int
     - admin: User

3. **Block**
   - Attributes:
     - color: String
     - points: int

4. **Level**
   - Attributes:
     - levelNumber: int
     - blockArrangement: List\<Block>
     - isRandom: boolean
     - numBlocks: int

5. **Player**
   - Attributes:
     - username: String
     - score: int
     - lives: int
     - currentLevel: int
     - pausedGame: Game

### Associations:
- **User** has a **GameMode**
- **User** can be a **Player** and optionally an **Admin**
- **Game** is created by an **Admin**
- **Game** has **Blocks**, **Levels**, and an **Admin**
- **Level** has a list of **Blocks**
- **Player** plays a **Game** and has a **pausedGame**
- **Game** has a **hallOfFame** which consists of **Players**

1. GameMode(Admin, Play): Represents the mode in which a user can interact with the game, either as an admin or a player.

Classes:

3. Block(color: String, points: int): Represents a block in the game with a color and a point value.

- **Player** is associated with a **Game** in progress

These classes and attributes represent the core entities and relationships described in the given description of the DestroyBlock application.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. GameMode(ADMIN, PLAYER): Represents the different modes a user can have - either as an admin or a player.
2. LevelType(FIXED, RANDOM): Represents the types of levels that can be defined - either fixed or random.

### Classes:
1. User(username: String, password: String, mode: GameMode): Represents a user with a unique username, password, and mode (admin or player).
2. Game(name: String, hallOfFame: List<Player>, blocks: List<Block>, levels: List<Level>, speedIncreaseFactor: Double, maxPaddleLength: Int, minPaddleLength: Int): Represents a game with its name, hall of fame, blocks, levels, and game settings.
3. Block(color: String, points: Int): Represents a block in the game with a color and points value.
4. Level(levelNumber: Int, blocksArrangement: List<Block>, levelType: LevelType, numBlocks: Int): Represents a level in the game with its number, block arrangement, type, and number of blocks.
5. Player(lives: Int, score: Int, currentLevel: Int, gameInProgress: Game): Represents a player with their lives, score, current level, and the game they are currently playing.
